result.execSummary:
The defendant Dallas Steven Randall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dallas Steven Randall

records.addlTxt:
8:53 AM Defendant Dallas Steven Randall in court, in custody.  Attorney Kevin Van Ert in court for Dallas Steven Randall.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Van Ert requests another status to allow for time to review the criminal complaint. State notes that previous counsel negotiated a time served deal. Attorney will fill out plea questionnaire, court will recall the case when that is complete. 

9:09 AM Court recalls the case. State recites the agreement. Defendant will plead to sole count. Sentence of 43 days jail with credit for 43 days. Payment of court costs. Victim's rights have been satisfied by the state. State notes that the victim initially asked for restitution but the State has been unable to contact the victim regarding the exact amount after multiple attempts. No restitution will be asked for. 
Defendant pleads no contest. Attorney Van Ert stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the defendant's plea and finds the plea is voluntarily, freely and intelligently made. Defendant is found guilty, judgment of conviction is entered. 
Court orders a sentence of 43 days jail with credit for 43 days (time served). Payment of court costs.

ADDRESS INFO for Dallas Steven Randall
Current: 407 E 5th St, Duluth, MN 55805 United States  (Effective: 09-28-2022)
Prior: 1614 Jefferson St, Duluth, MN 55812

1:27 PM Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for Dallas Steven Randall.  Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's address confirmed. Court quashes warrant, questions non appearance. Defendant notes that he accidentally missed his court date. State asks for $500 cash bail. No contact with Victim 1. State notes involuntary appearance today. Sate recites defendant's prior FTAs and recites defendant's previous criminal history and probation violations. Attorney Hoffman and defendant indicate that he is a lifelong resident of Duluth, was recently placed on probation in Duluth and does not have any other pending legal matters. Defendant is unable to post anything.
Court notes concerns over defendant's FTAs. Court recites previous bail ordered and bail reduction. 
Court orders $1,000 cash. No contact with Victim 1. Defendant is reminded about saying updated with current address. Defendant indicates that he stays at two addresses.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:12 AM Defendant Dallas Steven Randall not in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson in court for Dallas Steven Randall.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. State requests warrant and forfeiture of bail/bond. Court orders warrant (Douglas and adjoining including Ashland) and forfeiture of bail/bond. Attorney Anderson notes restitution for forfeited bail.

9:26 AM Defendant Dallas Steven Randall in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson appeared by phone for Dallas Steven Randall.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates matter resolved. Asks for another date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

8:32 AM Defendant Dallas Steven Randall in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson in court for Dallas Steven Randall.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates one more status. Court set status.
Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:15 AM Defendant Dallas Steven Randall in court with attorney Fredric B. Anderson.  Defendant Dallas Steven Randall in custody.  Mark Freuhauff appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State indicates defendant can post $100, not opposed to $100 cash bail. Court sees 2 FTA's. State indicates 2 FTA's in Minnesota, felony in this court was missed in January.  Anderson believes defendant can post $100 cash. 
Court order $100 cash bond with conditions of no contact with victim. Court instructs defendant to make sure he makes his scheduled court appearances.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim as listed in the ID Key.

03:24 PM Defendant Dallas Steven Randall in court with attorney Ellen Denise Craker.  Defendant Dallas Steven Randall in custody.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dallas Steven Randall appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant's address confirmed.  Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading.   States request on bail: $500 cash bond with conditions of no contact with victim 1. State receites prior criminal history. State indicates there are two F.T.A.'s.
Atty Craker indicates this a non-voilent misdemeanor. Defendant does have strong family ties here. He is employeed. Atty Craker requests recognizance bond. Atty Craker indicates Defendant is not able to post any money at this time. 
Court Orders $350 cash bond with conditions of   No contact with victim as listed in the ID Key.
Defendant does qualify.  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed Order to Seal Identification Key
